## Why Environmental Studies?

-   Growing up I had a passion for gardening, and even had my very own garden at 7 years old!

-   Being around animals at a very young age curated my love for pets and fueled my devotion towards consuming no meat products, a win for both me and the planet.

-   I was an avid participant in my high schools gardening club, and even participated in a few beach cleanups.

## Areas of Interest

Some topics learned in lectures that I really found interesting:

-   Biodiversity

-   Data Analysis

-   Ecology

-   Medicinal Botany

## Focus on Biodiversity Conservation

-   Every year, at least one species becomes extinct. [^1]
-   Biodiversity has been steadily decreasing since the industrial revolution, mainly due to land use change and its subsequent effects like habitat destruction, pollution, etc.
-   The ever so changing niche construction of these inconsistent urban environments provide further challenges like invasivity, competition, variability, etc.
-   Richmond and the surrounding cities are a fantastic area to study and analyze ecological survey data at varying levels of land use change.

[^1]: [*Adebayo O. LOSS OF BIODIVERSITY: THE BURGEONING THREAT TO HUMAN HEALTH. Ann Ib Postgrad Med. 2019 Jun;17(1):1-3. PMID: 31768149; PMCID: PMC6871202.*]{.underline}

## Sustainable Solutions

-   Citizen science involvement for survey data is a great method of gathering spatial observations of the desired biota. Good applications for this include:

    > iNaturalist (<https://www.inaturalist.org/>)
    >
    > ArcGIS Online (<https://www.arcgis.com/index.html>)

-   Planting native grasses and wildflowers in lawns instead of the homologous lawns we see today

    -   Virginia native lawn info: [Lawn Care for Earth Renewal](https://www.plantnovanatives.org/reducing-lawn)

-   Laws/legislation in place that provide protection for endangered species and their respective habitats

## Conclusion

Throughout my life, I have always felt partially responsible for the damage humans as a species have caused to the Earth, and simply being here adds onto the unforgivable debt.

This sense of responsibility drives my passion for ENVS and pushes me to be a more Eco-minded person in my everyday life by recycling, picking up after others, and overall reducing our burden on the one and only planet we call home.
